parent.body:
Funny you should say that.

Yes, but, brainwashing wont save you.
  
Im no doctor, but id say you need an ego. Bruh. There is no one in life you can count more on than yourself.
  
The only person, with 100% your well being in mind, is always you.
  
Heroes, will dissapoint you. They are echoes of what was, of things done. 
  
But theres an unspoken rule about meeting your heroes. Dont do it. They are never as good irl

post.body:
Go on it yourself, they're all gone. I noticed when I was in lounge and everything stopped loading. I refreshed and all the channels were gone.

I heard from multiple users that they'd randomly been kicked too.

Edit: False alarm, you have to type `?rank member` again and it apparently undid it for me somehow. But that's still really weird, and convenient timing too. Also the mod channel deletion and the deletion of many old channels really did happen (so I thought it happened again).

Edit 2: I was right to be suspicious of the timing. They did this because too many people were "raiding", meaning expressing dissenting opinions such as this:

![](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/730807967707824259/792845754283720745/unknown.png)
post.body_html:

post.body:
The reason RCP was able to know about @JosephGoebbel's ban so fast and siege all his guilds is because @captainmeta4 discussed it with the ruqqord mods in their private mod chat! So Meg was then able to tell RCP. Who knows how much more influence and special information the mods get. When this got leaked, cap *panicked* and deleted that entire mod channel and created a new one. He has a history of nuking channels when something about them gets exposed.

Supposedly this channel is for discord ban discussion and nothing else, but apparently they actually have a say in administrative decisions as well. I should also note that they also have a channel where they can see everyone's deleted messages and previous edit versions, despite not being admins, so that's a major privacy issue.

Edit: RCP probably just brigaded this thread. It was at 8 upvotes and suddenly dropped to 5 in a second.

Edit 2: Another downvote and all the other posts are getting downvote bombed too: https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/66iv/when-you-think-youve-finally-escaped

Literally several downvotes in seconds.

body:
For as "lazy" and not super active as you are, you're definitely the most talented in every way. You still crush everyone elses' abilities, even the ones they've been practicing their whole life, you're just like that. And creative on top of that. You do more in a day with the passive amount of activity than I have in my entire life. I can't even do stupid things, and I've never really been the one to start or be behind any happenings either.

Hopefully there's something out there I can grow to like that doesn't require talent to do. Because right now I don't have any hobbies at all, even though I'm obsessed with so many things my brain isn't built to be able to do them, and it's driving me insane because I'm not interested in watching tv all day like the people I got my genes from.
body_html:
For as "lazy" and not super active as you are, you're definitely the most talented in every way. You still crush everyone elses' abilities, even the ones they've been practicing their whole life, you're just like that. And creative on top of that. You do more in a day with the passive amount of activity than I have in my entire life. I can't even do stupid things, and I've never really been the one to start or be behind any happenings either.

Hopefully there's something out there I can grow to like that doesn't require talent to do. Because right now I don't have any hobbies at all, even though I'm obsessed with so many things my brain isn't built to be able to do them, and it's driving me insane because I'm not interested in watching tv all day like the people I got my genes from.

guild.description:
A place for exposing, documenting,and memeing the perceived and real 50 Cent Army, pro-CCP shills.
[Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/50_Cent_Party) explanation: "The 50 Cent Party, or 50 Cent Army (Chinese: äº”æ¯›å…š, often shortened as äº”æ¯›, wÇ”mÃ¡o, "five jiao"), is a [1][2] term for Internet commentators (Chinese: ç½‘ç»œè¯„è®ºå‘˜) who are reportedly hired by authorities of the People's Republic of China in an attempt to manipulatepublic opinion to the benefit of the Chinese Communist Party.[3][4] It was created during the early phases of the Internet's rollout to the wider public in China. The name derives from the allegation that commentators are said to be paid Â¥0.50 for every post,[5][6][7] though some speculate that they are probably not paid anything for the posts, instead being required to do so as a part of their official Party duties.[8] They create favourable comments or articles on popular Chinese social media networks that are intended to derail discussions that are unhelpful to the Communist Party and that promote narratives that serve the government's interests, together with disparaging comments and misinformation about political opponents and critics of the Chinese government, both domestic and abroad.[9][10][11] Its Chinese equivalent, "wumao"has been used as an insult by English speakers against people with perceived support for the government of China;[12]the term has also been cited in reports relating to Sinophobia.[13][14]"
guild.description_html: A place for exposing, documenting,and memeing the perceived and real 50 Cent Army, pro-CCP shills. Wikipedia explanation: "The 50 Cent Party, or 50 Cent Army (Chinese: äº”æ¯›å…š, often shortened as äº”æ¯›, wÇ”mÃ¡o, "five jiao"), is a [1][2] term for Internet commentators (Chinese: ç½‘ç»œè¯„è®ºå‘˜) who are reportedly hired by authorities of the People's Republic of China in an attempt to manipulatepublic opinion to the benefit of the Chinese Communist Party.[3][4] It was created during the early phases of the Internet's rollout to the wider public in China. The name derives from the allegation that commentators are said to be paid Â¥0.50 for every post,[5][6][7] though some speculate that they are probably not paid anything for the posts, instead being required to do so as a part of their official Party duties.[8] They create favourable comments or articles on popular Chinese social media networks that are intended to derail discussions that are unhelpful to the Communist Party and that promote narratives that serve the government's interests, together with disparaging comments and misinformation about political opponents and critics of the Chinese government, both domestic and abroad.[9][10][11] Its Chinese equivalent, "wumao"has been used as an insult by English speakers against people with perceived support for the government of China;[12]the term has also been cited in reports relating to Sinophobia.[13][14]"

post.body:
Go on it yourself, they're all gone. I noticed when I was in lounge and everything stopped loading. I refreshed and all the channels were gone.

I heard from multiple users that they'd randomly been kicked too.

Edit: False alarm, you have to type `?rank member` again and it apparently undid it for me somehow. But that's still really weird, and convenient timing too. Also the mod channel deletion and the deletion of many old channels really did happen (so I thought it happened again).

Edit 2: I was right to be suspicious of the timing. They did this because too many people were "raiding", meaning expressing dissenting opinions such as this:

![](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/730807967707824259/792845754283720745/unknown.png)

post.body:
The reason RCP was able to know about @JosephGoebbel's ban so fast and siege all his guilds is because @captainmeta4 discussed it with the ruqqord mods in their private mod chat! So Meg was then able to tell RCP. Who knows how much more influence and special information the mods get. When this got leaked, cap *panicked* and deleted that entire mod channel and created a new one. He has a history of nuking channels when something about them gets exposed.

Supposedly this channel is for discord ban discussion and nothing else, but apparently they actually have a say in administrative decisions as well. I should also note that they also have a channel where they can see everyone's deleted messages and previous edit versions, despite not being admins, so that's a major privacy issue.

Edit: RCP probably just brigaded this thread. It was at 8 upvotes and suddenly dropped to 5 in a second.

Edit 2: Another downvote and all the other posts are getting downvote bombed too: https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/66iv/when-you-think-youve-finally-escaped

Literally several downvotes in seconds.

guild.description:
A place for exposing, documenting,and memeing the perceived and real 50 Cent Army, pro-CCP shills.
[Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/50_Cent_Party) explanation: "The 50 Cent Party, or 50 Cent Army (Chinese: äº”æ¯›å…š, often shortened as äº”æ¯›, wÇ”mÃ¡o, "five jiao"), is a [1][2] term for Internet commentators (Chinese: ç½‘ç»œè¯„è®ºå‘˜) who are reportedly hired by authorities of the People's Republic of China in an attempt to manipulatepublic opinion to the benefit of the Chinese Communist Party.[3][4] It was created during the early phases of the Internet's rollout to the wider public in China. The name derives from the allegation that commentators are said to be paid Â¥0.50 for every post,[5][6][7] though some speculate that they are probably not paid anything for the posts, instead being required to do so as a part of their official Party duties.[8] They create favourable comments or articles on popular Chinese social media networks that are intended to derail discussions that are unhelpful to the Communist Party and that promote narratives that serve the government's interests, together with disparaging comments and misinformation about political opponents and critics of the Chinese government, both domestic and abroad.[9][10][11] Its Chinese equivalent, "wumao"has been used as an insult by English speakers against people with perceived support for the government of China;[12]the term has also been cited in reports relating to Sinophobia.[13][14]"
guild.description_html: A place for exposing, documenting,and memeing the perceived and real 50 Cent Army, pro-CCP shills. Wikipedia explanation: "The 50 Cent Party, or 50 Cent Army (Chinese: äº”æ¯›å…š, often shortened as äº”æ¯›, wÇ”mÃ¡o, "five jiao"), is a [1][2] term for Internet commentators (Chinese: ç½‘ç»œè¯„è®ºå‘˜) who are reportedly hired by authorities of the People's Republic of China in an attempt to manipulatepublic opinion to the benefit of the Chinese Communist Party.[3][4] It was created during the early phases of the Internet's rollout to the wider public in China. The name derives from the allegation that commentators are said to be paid Â¥0.50 for every post,[5][6][7] though some speculate that they are probably not paid anything for the posts, instead being required to do so as a part of their official Party duties.[8] They create favourable comments or articles on popular Chinese social media networks that are intended to derail discussions that are unhelpful to the Communist Party and that promote narratives that serve the government's interests, together with disparaging comments and misinformation about political opponents and critics of the Chinese government, both domestic and abroad.[9][10][11] Its Chinese equivalent, "wumao"has been used as an insult by English speakers against people with perceived support for the government of China;[12]the term has also been cited in reports relating to Sinophobia.[13][14]"
guild.name: 50CentArmy

post.body:
The reason RCP was able to know about @JosephGoebbel's ban so fast and siege all his guilds is because @captainmeta4 discussed it with the ruqqord mods in their private mod chat! So Meg was then able to tell RCP. Who knows how much more influence and special information the mods get. When this got leaked, cap *panicked* and deleted that entire mod channel and created a new one. He has a history of nuking channels when something about them gets exposed.

Supposedly this channel is for discord ban discussion and nothing else, but apparently they actually have a say in administrative decisions as well. I should also note that they also have a channel where they can see everyone's deleted messages and previous edit versions, despite not being admins, so that's a major privacy issue.

Edit: RCP probably just brigaded this thread. It was at 8 upvotes and suddenly dropped to 5 in a second.

Edit 2: Another downvote and all the other posts are getting downvote bombed too: https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/66iv/when-you-think-youve-finally-escaped

Literally several downvotes in seconds.

parent.body:
>I was a mistake

It will get better when you stop telling yourself that. The world will have enough opportunities to remind you of it if it's true, in the meantime make yourself a diary where you put nothing but your victories, no matter how small. Eventually as you'll be reading through it, you'll notice that it's incrementing both as you get better and as you notice your positives. Do not put ANY failures and force yourself past thinking too much over those.

And as I said, stop swooning over sfrohne, I bet you're creeping her out :0

body: Because every single person I know and every active user on ruqqus was invited except for me. And every other group does this too, for example xaiecon and another site that isn't open to the public yet.

guild.description:
A place for exposing, documenting,and memeing the perceived and real 50 Cent Army, pro-CCP shills.
[Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/50_Cent_Party) explanation: "The 50 Cent Party, or 50 Cent Army (Chinese: äº”æ¯›å…š, often shortened as äº”æ¯›, wÇ”mÃ¡o, "five jiao"), is a [1][2] term for Internet commentators (Chinese: ç½‘ç»œè¯„è®ºå‘˜) who are reportedly hired by authorities of the People's Republic of China in an attempt to manipulatepublic opinion to the benefit of the Chinese Communist Party.[3][4] It was created during the early phases of the Internet's rollout to the wider public in China. The name derives from the allegation that commentators are said to be paid Â¥0.50 for every post,[5][6][7] though some speculate that they are probably not paid anything for the posts, instead being required to do so as a part of their official Party duties.[8] They create favourable comments or articles on popular Chinese social media networks that are intended to derail discussions that are unhelpful to the Communist Party and that promote narratives that serve the government's interests, together with disparaging comments and misinformation about political opponents and critics of the Chinese government, both domestic and abroad.[9][10][11] Its Chinese equivalent, "wumao"has been used as an insult by English speakers against people with perceived support for the government of China;[12]the term has also been cited in reports relating to Sinophobia.[13][14]"
guild.description_html: A place for exposing, documenting,and memeing the perceived and real 50 Cent Army, pro-CCP shills. The name derives from the allegation that commentators are said to be paid Â¥0.50 for every post,[5][6][7] though some speculate that they are probably not paid anything for the posts, instead being required to do so as a part of their official Party duties.[8] They create favourable comments or articles on popular Chinese social media networks that are intended to derail discussions that are unhelpful to the Communist Party and that promote narratives that serve the government's interests, together with disparaging comments and misinformation about political opponents and critics of the Chinese government, both domestic and abroad.[9][10][11] Its Chinese equivalent, "wumao"has been used as an insult by English speakers against people with perceived support for the government of China;[12]the term has also been cited in reports relating to Sinophobia.[13][14]"
guild.name: 50CentArmy

body:
1. Seq and Ruq are both in the focus group, and so is @VILLAIN and I saw a few other RCP users on the list too. Of course those are now deleted because of all the channel purges you've done, I'd have to become a mod to see those messages again which isn't happening.

2. Meaning don't announce it everywhere, not fucking guard it with your life.
body_html:
1. Seq and Ruq are both in the focus group, and so is @VILLAIN and I saw a few other RCP users on the list too. Of course those are now deleted because of all the channel purges you've done, I'd have to become a mod to see those messages again which isn't happening.

  2. Meaning don't announce it everywhere, not fucking guard it with your life.

parent.body:
1. Focus group is made up mostly of non-mods (and not users like porc, no chill, etc). You wouldn't even know them.

2. That's how focus-groups work. We're not going share every single experimental UI and design piece.
parent.body_html:
1. Focus group is made up mostly of non-mods (and not users like porc, no chill, etc). You wouldn't even know them.

  2. That's how focus-groups work. We're not going share every single experimental UI and design piece.

post.body:
Go on it yourself, they're all gone. I noticed when I was in lounge and everything stopped loading. I refreshed and all the channels were gone.

I heard from multiple users that they'd randomly been kicked too.

Edit: False alarm, you have to type `?rank member` again and it apparently undid it for me somehow. But that's still really weird, and convenient timing too. Also the mod channel deletion and the deletion of many old channels really did happen (so I thought it happened again).

Edit 2: I was right to be suspicious of the timing. They did this because too many people were "raiding", meaning expressing dissenting opinions such as this:

![](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/730807967707824259/792845754283720745/unknown.png)
post.body_html:
Go on it yourself, they're all gone. I noticed when I was in lounge and everything stopped loading. I refreshed and all the channels were gone.

I heard from multiple users that they'd randomly been kicked too.

Edit 2: I was right to be suspicious of the timing. They did this because too many people were "raiding", meaning expressing dissenting opinions such as this:
